channel.title: AI Unfiltered
channel.description: Chinese AI • Open Source • Security • Incidents. Signal, not noise.

item.title: ByteDance Reportedly Developing Next-Gen “Doubao” AI Earbuds with Built-In Camera Module
item.description: ByteDance is developing next-gen Doubao AI earbuds with GoerTek, featuring a camera for vision-based AI interactions (not photography), focusing on deep smartphone integration.

item.title: DeepSeek Founder’s Hedge Fund Delivers 56.6% Returns in 2025, Managing Over $9.8 billion
item.description: The quantitative hedge fund owned by DeepSeek's founder recorded a 56.6% return in 2025, managing ~$9.8B, providing a potential war chest for its sibling AI company's ambitious development.

item.title: Xiaomi Responds to Early Reveal of SU7 Facelift: “Buying a Car Is a Big Decision—We Want Customers to Have More Time”
item.description: Xiaomi Auto announced its upgraded SU7 sedan three months ahead of its April launch, citing customer consideration time, and revealed major upgrades in safety, range, and autonomous driving tech.

item.title: Tencent’s Hunyuan Team Open-Sources HY-Motion 1.0: An AI Motion Model That Understands Vague Prompts and Generates High-Quality 3D Character Animations
item.description: Tencent open-sourced its 1B-parameter HY-Motion 1.0 model, which turns vague text prompts into high-quality 3D character animations, aiming to democratize tools for game devs and animators.

item.title: AI Programming Company DeepWisdom Raises $30.6 million , Launches Product “Atoms”
item.description: Shenzhen's DeepWisdom secured $30.6M, the largest funding in China's Coding Agent sector, and launched "Atoms," an AI tool that builds full-stack, revenue-ready websites in minutes through multi-agent collaboration.

item.title: Incident with Webhooks
item.description: Jan 14, 20:21 UTCInvestigating - We are investigating reports of degraded performance for Webhooks

item.title: Researchers Null-Route Over 550 Kimwolf and Aisuru Botnet Command Servers
item.description: The Black Lotus Labs team at Lumen Technologies said it null-routed traffic to more than 550 command-and-control (C2) nodes associated with the AISURU/Kimwolf botnet since early October 2025. AISURU and its Android counterpart, Kimwolf, have emerged as some of the biggest botnets in recent times,...

item.title: Aikido Security Raises $60 Million at $1 Billion Valuation
item.description: The developer security company has raised a total of more than $84 million in funding. The post Aikido Security Raises $60 Million at $1 Billion Valuation appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Investor Lawsuit Over CrowdStrike Outage Dismissed
item.description: A judge has ruled that the plaintiffs failed to demonstrate intent to defraud investors. The post Investor Lawsuit Over CrowdStrike Outage Dismissed appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: AI Agents Are Becoming Privilege Escalation Paths
item.description: AI agents have quickly moved from experimental tools to core components of daily workflows across security, engineering, IT, and operations. What began as individual productivity aids, like personal code assistants, chatbots, and copilots, has evolved into shared, organization-wide agents embedded...

item.title: RedVDS Cybercrime Service Disrupted by Microsoft and Law Enforcement
item.description: RedVDS enables threat actors to set up servers that can be used for phishing, BEC attacks, account takeover, and fraud. The post RedVDS Cybercrime Service Disrupted by Microsoft and Law Enforcement appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Hackers Exploit c-ares DLL Side-Loading to Bypass Security and Deploy Malware
item.description: Security experts have disclosed details of an active malware campaign that's exploiting a DLL side-loading vulnerability in a legitimate binary associated with the open-source c-ares library to bypass security controls and deliver a wide range of commodity trojans and stealers. "Attackers achieve...

item.title: Predator Spyware Turns Failed Attacks Into Intelligence for Future Exploits
item.description: The Predator spyware is more sophisticated and dangerous than previously realized. The post Predator Spyware Turns Failed Attacks Into Intelligence for Future Exploits appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Novee Emerges From Stealth With $51.5 Million in Funding
item.description: Novee provides continuous AI-driven penetration testing to uncover and address novel vulnerabilities. The post Novee Emerges From Stealth With $51.5 Million in Funding appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: The Download: next-gen nuclear, and the data center backlash
item.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. How next-generation nuclear reactors break out of the 20th-century blueprint The popularity of commercial nuclear reactors has surged in...

item.title: Claude Opus 4.5 model experiencing degraded performance
item.description: Jan 14, 12:23 UTCResolved - This incident has been resolved. Thank you for your patience and understanding as we addressed this issue. A detailed root cause analysis will be shared as soon as it is available.Jan 14, 11:45 UTCUpdate - We are continuing to investigate issues with Claude Opus 4.5 and...

item.title: Fortinet Fixes Critical FortiSIEM Flaw Allowing Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
item.description: Fortinet has released updates to fix a critical security flaw impacting FortiSIEM that could allow an unauthenticated attacker to achieve code execution on susceptible instances. The operating system (OS) injection vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-64155, is rated 9.4 out of 10.0 on the CVSS...

item.title: Data centers are amazing. Everyone hates them.
item.description: Behold, the hyperscale data center!  Massive structures, with thousands of specialized computer chips running in parallel to perform the complex calculations required by advanced AI models. A single facility can cover millions of square feet, built with millions of pounds of steel, aluminum,...

item.title: New Research: 64% of 3rd-Party Applications Access Sensitive Data Without Justification
item.description: Research analyzing 4,700 leading websites reveals that 64% of third-party applications now access sensitive data without business justification, up from 51% in 2024.  Government sector malicious activity spiked from 2% to 12.9%, while 1 in 7 Education sites show active compromise. Specific...

item.title: Copilot's GPT-5.1 model has degraded performance
item.description: Jan 14, 10:52 UTCResolved - This incident has been resolved. Thank you for your patience and understanding as we addressed this issue. A detailed root cause analysis will be shared as soon as it is available.Jan 14, 10:32 UTCUpdate - We are continuing to investigate issues with the GPT-5.1 model....

item.title: Designing safer links: secure connectivity for operational technology
item.description: New principles help organisations to design, review, and secure connectivity to (and within) OT systems.

item.title: Elevated error rates on Opus 4.5
item.description: Jan 14, 08:34 UTCInvestigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: Bridging the Trust Gap: Clinician-Validated Hybrid Explainable AI for Maternal Health Risk Assessment in Bangladesh
item.description: arXiv:2601.07866v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: While machine learning shows promise for maternal health risk prediction, clinical adoption in resource-constrained settings faces a critical barrier: lack of explainability and trust. This study presents a hybrid explainable AI (XAI) framework...

item.title: Executable Ontologies in Game Development: From Algorithmic Control to Semantic World Modeling
item.description: arXiv:2601.07964v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This paper examines the application of Executable Ontologies (EO), implemented through the boldsea framework, to game development. We argue that EO represents a paradigm shift: a transition from algorithmic behavior programming to semantic world...

item.title: When Models Know When They Do Not Know: Calibration, Cascading, and Cleaning
item.description: arXiv:2601.07965v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: When a model knows when it does not know, many possibilities emerge. The first question is how to enable a model to recognize that it does not know. A promising approach is to use confidence, computed from the model's internal signals, to reflect its...

item.title: Reasoning over Precedents Alongside Statutes: Case-Augmented Deliberative Alignment for LLM Safety
item.description: arXiv:2601.08000v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Ensuring that Large Language Models (LLMs) adhere to safety principles without refusing benign requests remains a significant challenge. While OpenAI introduces deliberative alignment (DA) to enhance the safety of its o-series models through reasoning...

item.title: Internal Deployment Gaps in AI Regulation
item.description: arXiv:2601.08005v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Frontier AI regulations primarily focus on systems deployed to external users, where deployment is more visible and subject to outside scrutiny. However, high-stakes applications can occur internally when companies deploy highly capable systems within...

item.title: Hierarchical Sparse Plus Low Rank Compression of LLM
item.description: arXiv:2601.07839v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Modern large language models (LLMs) place extraordinary pressure on memory and compute budgets, making principled compression indispensable for both deployment and continued training. We present Hierarchical Sparse Plus Low-Rank (HSS) compression, a...

item.title: Affect and Effect: Limitations of regularisation-based continual learning in EEG-based emotion classification
item.description: arXiv:2601.07858v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Generalisation to unseen subjects in EEG-based emotion classification remains a challenge due to high inter-and intra-subject variability. Continual learning (CL) poses a promising solution by learning from a sequence of tasks while mitigating...

item.title: RewriteNets: End-to-End Trainable String-Rewriting for Generative Sequence Modeling
item.description: arXiv:2601.07868v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Dominant sequence models like the Transformer represent structure implicitly through dense attention weights, incurring quadratic complexity. We propose RewriteNets, a novel neural architecture built on an alternative paradigm: explicit, parallel...

item.title: HOSC: A Periodic Activation with Saturation Control for High-Fidelity Implicit Neural Representations
item.description: arXiv:2601.07870v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Periodic activations such as sine preserve high-frequency information in implicit neural representations (INRs) through their oscillatory structure, but often suffer from gradient instability and limited control over multi-scale behavior. We introduce...

item.title: Multiplicative Orthogonal Sequential Editing for Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2601.07873v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Knowledge editing aims to efficiently modify the internal knowledge of large language models (LLMs) without compromising their other capabilities. The prevailing editing paradigm, which appends an update matrix to the original parameter matrix, has...

item.title: EmbeddingRWKV: State-Centric Retrieval with Reusable States
item.description: arXiv:2601.07861v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Current Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems typically employ a traditional two-stage pipeline: an embedding model for initial retrieval followed by a reranker for refinement. However, this paradigm suffers from significant inefficiency due to...

item.title: A Human-Centric Pipeline for Aligning Large Language Models with Chinese Medical Ethics
item.description: arXiv:2601.07954v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent advances in large language models have enabled their application to a range of healthcare tasks. However, aligning LLMs with the nuanced demands of medical ethics, especially under complex real world scenarios, remains underexplored. In this...

item.title: Knowing But Not Doing: Convergent Morality and Divergent Action in LLMs
item.description: arXiv:2601.07972v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Value alignment is central to the development of safe and socially compatible artificial intelligence. However, how Large Language Models (LLMs) represent and enact human values in real-world decision contexts remains under-explored. We present...

item.title: Explaining Generalization of AI-Generated Text Detectors Through Linguistic Analysis
item.description: arXiv:2601.07974v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: AI-text detectors achieve high accuracy on in-domain benchmarks, but often struggle to generalize across different generation conditions such as unseen prompts, model families, or domains. While prior work has reported these generalization gaps, there...

item.title: Cross-Cultural Expert-Level Art Critique Evaluation with Vision-Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2601.07984v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Vision-Language Models (VLMs) excel at visual perception, yet their ability to interpret cultural meaning in art remains under-validated. We present a tri-tier evaluation framework for cross-cultural art-critique assessment: Tier I computes automated...

item.title: Elevated error rates for ChatGPT users
item.description: Status: ResolvedAll impacted services have now fully recovered.Affected components Conversations (Operational)

item.title: Patch Tuesday, January 2026 Edition
item.description: Microsoft today issued patches to plug at least 113 security holes in its various Windows operating systems and supported software. Eight of the vulnerabilities earned Microsoft's most-dire "critical" rating, and the company warns that attackers are already exploiting one of the bugs fixed today.

A detailed root cause analysis will be shared as soon as it is available.Jan 13, 23:36 UTCUpdate - We are continuing to investigate increased latency with code...

item.title: Veo 3.1 Ingredients to Video: More consistency, creativity and control
item.description: Our latest Veo update generates lively, dynamic clips that feel natural and engaging — and supports vertical video generation.

item.title: Motion Attribution for Video Generation
item.description: Despite the rapid progress of video generation models, the role of data in influencing motion is poorly understood. We present Motive (MOTIon attribution for Video gEneration), a motion-centric, gradient-based data attribution framework that scales to modern, large, high-quality video datasets and...

item.title: The Download: sodium-ion batteries and China’s bright tech future
item.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. Sodium-ion batteries are making their way into cars—and the grid For decades, lithium-ion batteries have powered our phones, laptops, and...

item.title: VLingNav: Embodied Navigation with Adaptive Reasoning and Visual-Assisted Linguistic Memory
item.description: VLA models have shown promising potential in embodied navigation by unifying perception and planning while inheriting the strong generalization abilities of large VLMs. However, most existing VLA models rely on reactive mappings directly from observations to actions, lacking the explicit reasoning...

item.title: End-to-End Video Character Replacement without Structural Guidance
item.description: Controllable video character replacement with a user-provided identity remains a challenging problem due to the lack of paired video data. Prior works have predominantly relied on a reconstruction-based paradigm that requires per-frame segmentation masks and explicit structural guidance (e.g.,...

item.title: Ministral 3
item.description: We introduce the Ministral 3 series, a family of parameter-efficient dense language models designed for compute and memory constrained applications, available in three model sizes: 3B, 8B, and 14B parameters. For each model size, we release three variants: a pretrained base model for...

item.title: Increased rate of errors for Opus 4.5
item.description: Jan 13, 07:49 UTCResolved - This incident has been resolved.Jan 13, 07:39 UTCMonitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.Jan 13, 07:27 UTCInvestigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: JudgeRLVR: Judge First, Generate Second for Efficient Reasoning
item.description: Reinforcement Learning with Verifiable Rewards (RLVR) has become a standard paradigm for reasoning in Large Language Models. However, optimizing solely for final-answer correctness often drives models into aimless, verbose exploration, where they rely on exhaustive trial-and-error tactics rather...
